info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 4:44PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Rensselaer, southern Bennington and southwestern Windham Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 443 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Grafton, or 9 miles south of Hoosick Falls, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Bennington, Williamstown, Pownal, Grafton, Berlin, Hoosick, North Bennington, Woodford, Old Bennington, Searsburg, Glastenbury, Somerset, Paper Mill Village, Sodom, Petersburg Junction, East Hoosick, Babcock Lake, South Shaftsbury, Center Berlin and Petersburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for western Massachusetts...east central New York...and southern Vermont.
